intro: Eustephia macleanica, commonly known as the Maclean's eustephia, is a flowering plant native to the Andes Mountains in South America. It belongs to the family Apiaceae, which includes carrots and parsley, and is characterized by its finely divided, fern-like leaves. The plant produces small, white to pale yellow flowers arranged in umbels, typical of the family. It thrives in cool, moist environments and is often found in high-altitude regions. Due to its ornamental value and limited distribution, it is considered a rare and specialized species.
